Class MeccanumState

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.kinematics.MeccanumState

  • public class MeccanumState
extends java.lang.Object
    A state for a meccanum chassis.
    Since:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

      • normalize

        public MeccanumState normalize(double max)
        Create a new (normalized) meccanum state.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum power value. This is the highest value the normalized state can have for any individual power value.
        Returns:
        a normalized meccanum state.

      • normalizeFromMaxUnderOne

        public MeccanumState normalizeFromMaxUnderOne()
        Normalize the meccanum state from the state's maximum power value. If the state's maximum power value is greater than 1.0, 1.0 will be used in place of the maximum power value.
        Returns:
        a normalized meccanum state.

      • add

        public MeccanumState add(MeccanumState state)
        Add two meccanum states together. I have absolutely no idea why anybody would literally ever use this method ever.
        Parameters:
        state - the state to add.
        Returns:
        the sum of the two states.

      • multiply

        public MeccanumState multiply(MeccanumState state)
        Multiply two meccanum states together.
        Parameters:
        state - the state to multiply by.
        Returns:
        the product of the two states.

      • multiply

        public MeccanumState multiply(double multiplier)
        Multiply a meccanum state's four motor values based on a multiplier.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - the multiplier to multiply each of the power values by.
        Returns:
        the multiplied meccanum state.
